intro: Chrysopsis falcata, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, composite flower heads that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chrysopsis falcata is often found in open habitats like grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
